thread.title: Huge response prompts organizers of workshop for Oregon pot grower to relocate
thread.title_full: Huge response prompts organizers of workshop for Oregon pot grower to relocate | OregonLive.com

author: Noelle Crombie | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Huge response prompts organizers of workshop for Oregon pot grower to relocate
text:
A workshop aimed at Oregon's marijuana producers has been moved to the Salem Armory.
The workshop was relocated after organizers received an overwhelming response.
The Oregon Farm Bureau and the Oregon Association of Nurseries will host the event Oct. 14. The meeting will focus on the latest state regulations for marijuana production, from pesticides and lab testing to water rights to land use.
Officials from state agencies that deal with regulated marijuana and representatives of the Oregon Water Resources Congress, the farm bureau and the nursery association will address the group.
The armory is located at 2310 17th Street in Salem. The suggested donation to help cover the cost of the event is $10.
Two sessions will be offered, one from 9 a.m. to noon and the other from 1 p.m. to 4 p.m. Interested in attending? RSVP by Oct. 12 to Jenny Dresler at jenny@oregonfb.org.
-- Noelle Crombie
503-276-7184; @noellecrombie
